How to Generate a Signature from the URL &SIG2NOTE;
The algorithm used to generate a signature is described in the following procedure. You can use the programming language of your choice to implement this algorithm.
To create a signature from the URL
Calculate an RFC 2104-compliant HMAC with the string you just created, your Secret Access Key as the key, and SHA256 or SHA1 as the hash algorithm. For more information, go to http://www.rfc.net/rfc2104.html.
Encode the resulting signature value using Base64.
The resulting value from the encoding process is the signature value, which you put in the HTML form's signature parameter.
